name: Arsenicum sulfuratum flavum
Relationship: Arsenic sulph. rub. (influenza with intense catarrhal symptoms, great prostration and high temperature, purulent discharges, psoriasis, acne, and sciatica. Chilly even before a fire. Itching in various parts. Pellagra.
Common names: Arsenic Trisulph Yellow Sulfuret of Arsenic. Orpiment
details: Needle pricks from within outwards in chest; also on forehead, right side. Sticking behind ear. Difficult respiration. Skin chafed about genitals. Leucoderma and squamous syphilides. Sciatica and pain around the knee.
